summary: Dynamic full-stack developer portfolio website with a public responsive frontend, SEO optimization, and a secure admin dashboard to manage projects, skills, about content, contact messages, resume, and developer avatar without code changes, built with Laravel + MySQL and Vue.js (or Blade), deployment-ready for Linux/Nginx, with admin authentication using email/password login.
architectural_notes: Tech stack: Laravel backend + MySQL database; frontend Vue.js or Blade with Bootstrap/Tailwind.
Authentication to use Laravel Breeze or Jetstream for admin login.
Admin panel must support full dynamic content management (projects, skills, about, contact messages).
Deployment target: Linux server with Nginx/Apache; performance-focused and scalable.
Hero typing/rotating-text effect: set typingWords to ['Developer','Designer','Database','Debugger','DevOps']. Համընկնում է user-provided list/comments; replaces prior word list.

Decision: add/implement email+password admin authentication for the admin panel (likely via Laravel Breeze/Jetstream) instead of Internet Identity-only access; ensure /admin presents a login flow when unauthenticated.
Direct contact email should be configurable (admin-managed or env/config-driven) and displayed consistently across the site.
Introduce media/file handling for admin-managed assets (resume PDF and avatar image): upload, storage path, validation, and public serving.
SEO: implement per-page meta tags (title/description), Open Graph/Twitter cards, sitemap.xml + robots.txt, canonical URLs, and (where appropriate) JSON-LD structured data.
Assumption raised: admin area may only need to support a single admin user (no multi-user accounts/roles), potentially allowing a simplified authentication model.
known_issues: Hero typing word list requirement is inconsistent across notes/features (previously included 'Data'; user now requests 'Debugger' instead).
Admin authentication approach is inconsistent across requirements/implementation (Internet Identity-only vs Laravel Breeze/Jetstream email/password).
Admin login flow bug: after successful admin login, user is not redirected to the admin dashboard.
Resume uploading/management feature is not working as expected.
Developer avatar upload/selection/display feature is not working as expected.

existing_features.title: Implement a responsive public portfolio website with sections/pages: Home (hero + CTAs), About, Skills, Projects (card grid), Experience (timeline), and Contact (form + social links), using the exact user-provided English copy for the Hero and About sections.

Create a coherent modern visual theme for the entire app (typography, spacing, color system, components) with smooth, subtle animations; include an optional dark mode toggle and ensure the UI remains clean and professional on mobile and desktop. Do not use a blue/purple primary palette.

Implement secure admin authentication and authorization using Internet Identity. Restrict all admin-only backend operations (create/update/delete projects, manage skills, update about content, view contact messages, manage experience and social links) to authenticated admins.

Build an Admin Dashboard UI that allows managing site content without code changes: Projects CRUD (including image upload), Skills management (add/edit level and category), About content editor, Experience timeline editor, Social links editor, and an inbox view of contact form submissions.
Seed the portfolio with initial content matching the provided example projects and skill lists so the public site displays meaningful data on first load.
Implement the public Contact form flow end-to-end: validate inputs on the frontend, submit to the backend, persist messages, and show a clear success/failure state to the user.

Implement a "Download Resume" button behavior that downloads a static resume file from the frontend’s public assets. Provide a placeholder resume file in the repo that can be replaced later without code changes.

Implement premium project cards with: Project Title, Description, Technologies Used, Live Demo button (when present), GitHub button (when present), and Project Image, with responsive layout and accessible interaction states.

Replace the static Home page hero headline text "Full-Stack Developer" with a typing-style animated headline where the "D" word cycles through 5 words, showing each word sequentially as if typed (must include at least: "Develop" and "Design"). Keep the overall headline meaning as "Full-Stack" + animated "D" word, and ensure the animation is smooth and professional.
Update the Home page hero typing animation word list to exactly: ['Developer', 'Designer', 'Database', 'DevOps', 'Data'].

Update the Home page hero typing animation word list (the `typingWords` constant in `frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx`) to exactly: ['Developer','Designer','Database','Debugger','DevOps'] in that order.
Update the frontend admin access flow so that visiting `/admin` while not logged in shows an email/password login form (not the current Internet Identity LoginButton-only experience).

Implement frontend session storage for the admin login (e.g., storing a returned session token) and update admin guarding logic to use the new backend session validation rather than Internet Identity identity state for admin access decisions.

Adjust the admin UI header actions to reflect the new auth model (email/password): remove or de-emphasize Internet Identity login/logout controls in the admin area so the admin panel login/logout is consistent with the new flow.
Ensure that after a successful admin email/password login, the UI redirects the user away from the login form to the intended admin destination (defaulting to the admin dashboard at `/admin`).

Fix admin session state propagation so that a successful login updates the authenticated state consistently across the admin layout/guard and login form (even when `useAdminSession()` is used in multiple components).
Add a visible loading state when an authenticated admin clicks the Logout button so the user can clearly see that logout is in progress until the operation completes.
Expose a dedicated logout pending/loading flag from the admin session hook so UI components can reliably render a loader during logout without conflating it with login or session validation loading.

Fix the `/admin` unauthenticated experience so it never gets stuck on the full-page "Loading..." screen and instead reliably shows the email/password Admin login form when there is no stored admin session token.

Update `useAdminSession()` so its `isLoading` value reflects real loading work and does not become true indefinitely due to React Query's initial/disabled query state; ensure `isLoading` is false when `sessionToken` is null and no login mutation is pending.

Remove duplicate/competing admin-session state consumers in the admin layout by ensuring `AdminLayout` derives `isAuthenticated`/`isLoading` from a single `useAdminSession()` usage (and avoid separately calling `useAdminGuard()` there), so the admin guard, login form, and header/logout controls share consistent state.
Update the portfolio's displayed/linked direct email address to `bajrangiyadav330@gmail.com` wherever it appears as a direct email link (including the "Direct Email" card on the Contact page).
Update the public "Download Resume" UX to download the latest admin-uploaded resume (with a sensible fallback when no resume has been uploaded yet).
Add an Admin Dashboard feature to upload/replace the resume file, including basic validation and clear success/error feedback.
Add an Admin Dashboard feature to upload/select the developer avatar and update the public site to display the selected avatar dynamically.

Fix frontend query typing/option-unwrapping for `getResume()` and `getAvatar()` results so the UI reliably detects when a file exists and correctly reads `blob`, `name`, and `uploadedAt` (Motoko optional types must be handled correctly).

Fix the public-facing resume download and avatar display to use the latest admin-uploaded files when present, and fall back gracefully when none exists (resume: existing static fallback; avatar: `/assets/generated/avatar.dim_512x512.png`).

Implement route-aware SEO head management for the React SPA so each public page sets an appropriate document title and SEO meta tags (description, canonical URL, Open Graph, Twitter Card), and ensure admin routes are marked as noindex.
Add a static `robots.txt` and `sitemap.xml` to the frontend public assets suitable for a single-page portfolio with the existing public routes, and exclude admin routes from indexing.
Add basic JSON-LD structured data for the portfolio site (Website + Person/Professional profile) on public pages to improve search result enrichment.
Update the baseline HTML head in `frontend/index.html` to include sensible default SEO tags that are safe as fallbacks, while allowing the route-aware SEO system to override them at runtime.
Improve the Admin Experience page UX so that when an Experience create/update/delete request fails due to authorization, the UI clearly prompts the admin to re-login and does not silently fail.

Ensure the admin login UI shows a clear login error when backend login fails due to authorization/role/permission issues, and does not display misleading "assign user roles" messaging to the admin user.

Add a new public page at route `/create` (CreatePage) that showcases the developer’s work and services, includes strong CTAs to contact/hire, and provides clearly labeled advertisement placement blocks suitable for monetization (without integrating any third-party ad networks/scripts). All user-facing text on this page must be in English.
Add the Create page to the public navigation so users can easily discover it on desktop and mobile menus.
Update the route-aware SEO configuration to include `/create` with an appropriate title, description, and OG image entry, consistent with the existing SEO system.
Add the `/create` route to the static sitemap so search engines can discover it.

new_feature_requests.summary: Build responsive public portfolio frontend with sections: Home (hero + CTAs), About, Skills, Projects, Experience timeline, Contact page
Dynamic Projects page with premium project cards (title, description, tech stack, live demo link, GitHub link, image) and seed with 3 example projects
Skills section with categorized skills and visual indicators (icons/progress bars) editable from admin
Contact form (name/email/message) with storage and social links (GitHub, LinkedIn, email) on frontend
Secure Admin Panel with authentication (Laravel Breeze/Jetstream) and dashboard for managing site content
Admin CRUD for Projects including image upload, edit, delete
Admin management for Skills (add/update skill levels) and About section content updates
Admin inbox for viewing contact messages submitted via contact form
Design requirements: modern clean UI, smooth animations, optional dark mode, premium project card styling
Deployment-ready setup for Linux server with Nginx/Apache support

Implement backend data models and APIs to support fully dynamic content for the portfolio: About content, Skills (with category and level), Projects (title, description, technologies, liveDemoUrl, githubUrl, image), Experience entries, Social links, and Contact messages (name, email, message, createdAt).

Update the hero headline text: replace/modify "Full-Stack Developer" to use a typing-style animation that cycles through multiple "D" words (e.g., Develop, Design, etc.), showing each word sequentially like typed text.

Add email/password-based admin authentication (login page at /admin or /login) so the admin panel can be accessed with credentials like admin@gmail.com / Admin@92505; migrate/replace prior Internet Identity-only gating as needed.

Implement email/password-based admin authentication in the Motoko backend, using the exact admin credentials: email `admin@gmail.com` and password `Admin@92505`. Provide backend APIs to (1) log in with email+password, (2) validate an existing admin session, and (3) log out.

Replace the current Internet Identity-only admin authorization checks in backend admin-only methods with checks based on the new email/password admin session mechanism (so admin CRUD works after email/password login even if the caller is not an Internet Identity admin principal).

Add stable state and upgrade-safe persistence for the new admin credential and session data. Create `backend/migration.mo` to preserve existing portfolio data across upgrades while introducing new auth-related stable variables.
Add a loading indicator/loader during admin logout so the user sees the action is processing until completion (then redirect/update auth state).
Update the portfolio’s direct contact email address to bajrangiyadav330@gmail.com wherever it is displayed/linked (e.g., Contact section, footer, social/email link).
Add resume uploading/management feature so the admin can upload/replace the resume file from the dashboard (and the public site Download Resume button serves the latest uploaded file).
Add developer avatar selection/management feature so the admin can upload/select the developer profile avatar shown on the public site (e.g., hero/about).
Implement backend support for an admin-managed resume file that can be uploaded/replaced from the Admin Dashboard and then downloaded by public users as the current resume.
Implement backend support for a developer avatar that can be set by an admin (upload/select) and displayed on the public site (e.g., About page avatar).

Fix backend authorization for admin resume/avatar upload so it works with the current email/password admin session model (not AccessControl role checks that may not be set for the logged-in admin). Ensure `adminUploadResume` and `adminUploadAvatar` accept requests from a successfully authenticated admin and reject unauthenticated callers with a clear error.

Ensure resume and avatar files persist correctly in backend state and remain available after canister upgrades/redeployments (resume/avatar should not disappear after an update). Add/adjust upgrade-safe state handling as needed while respecting the single-actor architecture.
Add SEO to the public portfolio site (e.g., meta titles/descriptions, Open Graph/Twitter tags, sitemap.xml, robots.txt, canonical URLs, and basic structured data) to improve search visibility.

Fix backend authorization so that an authenticated admin (via the existing email/password admin session) can create, update, and delete Experience entries from the Admin Panel without getting an "Unauthorized" error.
Clarify/simplify admin authentication assuming there will be only a single admin user (no multi-user/roles needed); adjust admin login approach accordingly if desired.

Update backend admin authentication/authorization to assume a single admin user and authorize admin-only operations purely by the existing email/password admin session (no role assignment, no multi-user roles).
Add a new "Create" page to showcase work, attract clients, and support running advertisements for online income.

projectName: Dynamic developer portfolio with public site and authenticated admin dashboard (projects/skills/about/contact)
